name: Research Guitar Types and Styles
description: Explore different types of guitars (acoustic, electric, classical) and playing styles to decide which best suits your interests.

name: Introduction to Unit Testing (JUnit)
description: Understand the importance of testing in software development. Learn how to write and run basic unit tests for Java code using the JUnit framework.

name: Understand Control Flow and Loops
description: Learn and practice `if-else` statements, `switch` statements, `for` loops, `while` loops, and `do-while` loops. Solve problems requiring conditional logic and iteration.

name: Establish a Consistent Practice Routine
description: Set up a regular schedule for guitar practice to ensure continuous improvement and make playing a habit.

name: Web Development with ASP.NET Core
description: Learn the fundamentals of building web APIs and web applications using ASP.NET Core (MVC or Razor Pages). Understand HTTP, REST principles, and basic routing.

name: Initial Prototyping/Drafting
description: Begin with a small-scale prototype, a proof of concept, or the initial draft/layout of your creation. This step helps validate your design and identify potential issues early.

name: Fundamentals of Programming & C# Basics
description: Understand core programming concepts (variables, data types, operators, control flow), C# syntax, console applications, and basic input/output. Focus on setting up your development environment (Visual Studio Code or Visual Studio).

name: Learn Your First Simple Song
description: Apply your learned chords and strumming patterns to play a complete, simple song from start to finish.

name: Ideation & Brainstorming
description: Dedicate time to brainstorm various ideas for what you want to make. Consider your interests, available resources, and desired outcome. Select one specific idea to pursue.

name: Learn Core Java APIs (Collections, Strings, Exceptions)
description: Explore essential Java APIs, including the Collections Framework (`ArrayList`, `HashMap`, `HashSet`), String manipulation methods, and robust exception handling using `try-catch-finally` blocks.

name: Testing & Evaluation
description: Thoroughly test your creation to ensure it functions as intended. Gather feedback if applicable. Make any final adjustments or improvements based on testing results.

name: Research & Planning
description: Once an idea is chosen, research how to make it. Identify necessary steps, techniques, materials, and tools. Create a detailed plan or design sketch.

name: Set Up Development Environment and Basic Syntax
description: Install Java Development Kit (JDK) and an Integrated Development Environment (IDE) like IntelliJ IDEA or Eclipse. Write your first 'Hello, World!' program. Understand variables, data types, operators, and basic input/output operations.

name: Learn Basic Database Connectivity (JDBC)
description: Understand how to connect Java applications to relational databases (e.g., H2, MySQL, PostgreSQL) using JDBC (Java Database Connectivity) for performing CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations.

name: Learn Basic Guitar Fundamentals
description: Understand how to properly hold the guitar, fret notes, and perform basic strumming techniques.

name: Unit Testing & Best Practices
description: Understand the importance of testing. Learn to write unit tests using frameworks like NUnit or xUnit. Explore coding best practices, common design patterns, and SOLID principles.

name: Practice Regular Strumming and Fingerpicking Patterns
description: Develop rhythm and dexterity by practicing various strumming patterns and simple fingerpicking exercises.

name: Database Integration & ORMs
description: Learn to connect C# applications to databases (e.g., SQL Server, SQLite) using ADO.NET and an Object-Relational Mapper (ORM) like Entity Framework Core. Practice CRUD operations.

name: Introduction to Advanced Java Concepts
description: Get familiar with Generics for type-safe code, Lambda expressions for functional programming, and basic concurrency concepts using Threads.

name: Gathering Materials & Tools
description: Acquire all the materials, components, and tools identified in the planning phase. Ensure you have everything ready before starting the hands-on creation.

name: Advanced C# Features
description: Explore LINQ (Language Integrated Query), Generics, Collections, Delegates, Events, Asynchronous Programming (async/await), and Error Handling (try-catch-finally).

name: Master Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) Fundamentals
description: Deeply understand core OOP concepts: classes, objects, constructors, encapsulation, inheritance, polymorphism, and abstraction. Create simple class hierarchies and interfaces.

name: Find Learning Resources
description: Identify and choose your primary learning resources, such as online tutorials, beginner books, or a local guitar instructor.

name: .NET Ecosystem & Desktop Applications (WPF/WinForms)
description: Understand the .NET platform (.NET Framework/.NET), CLR, and BCL. Learn to build basic graphical user interface (GUI) applications using either WPF or Windows Forms.

name: Explore Build Tools and Version Control
description: Learn to use a build automation tool like Maven or Gradle for project management and dependency handling. Understand the basics of Git for version control and integrate with GitHub.

name: Construction & Execution
description: Proceed with the main construction or implementation of your 'something' based on your plan and any lessons learned from prototyping. Focus on building the core structure or functionality.

name: Acquire a Guitar and Essential Gear
description: Purchase or borrow a guitar along with necessary accessories such as picks, a tuner, a strap, and an amplifier (if electric).

name: Work with File I/O and Streams
description: Learn how to read from and write to files using various stream classes (e.g., `FileInputStream`, `FileOutputStream`, `BufferedReader`, `BufferedWriter`) and path manipulation.

name: Build a Simple Command-Line Application
description: Apply all learned concepts to develop a small, practical command-line application such as a to-do list manager, a simple calculator, or a contact book.

name: Project Development & Deployment
description: Apply all learned concepts by building a complete, small-to-medium-sized project (e.g., a full-stack web application, a desktop utility, or a simple game). Learn basic deployment strategies for your chosen application type.

name: Master Basic Chords and Scales
description: Learn and practice common open chords (e.g., G, C, D, E, A, Em, Am) and a simple major or minor scale.

name: Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) in C#
description: Master classes, objects, encapsulation, inheritance, polymorphism, interfaces, and abstract classes. Practice creating simple object-oriented models.
